Reviews.Title: “service lapse”
Reviews.Author: d33jBocaRaton_FL
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight layover and based on the TripAdvisor reviews, we stayed here one night. We were groggy from jet lag so we forgot to look for the hotel bus. The taxi cost 27 euros. We saw a stewardess waiting outside the hotel so if the airline personnel stay here, it must be decent. Even though we arrived at 11 am (before the normal check-in), our room was ready. The hotel and room deserve 4 stars. The metro stop was only two blocks away. The hotel is located in a business park and there were no nearby restaurants which were open on Sunday. If we were familiar with the metro, we could have taken it from the airport only two stops to the hotel. To my surprise the metro ran frequently even though it was Sunday. The front desk was helpful in finding the closest metro stop to the Sorolla Museum we wanted to see. The next day we did take the free bus to the airport. It leaves from the hotel every half hour. Our only complaint is that the order card said room service was available 24 hours a day and we ordered breakfast to be delivered at 5 am. When we called for the wake-up call, we told the front desk we wanted breakfast at 5 am, and he instructed us to leave the order card on our door knob. When they called to wake us up at 4:30 am (Monday Aug 27, 2012), they said they could not bring breakfast because the dining room opened at 6 am. When we went downstairs, wait staff had arrived at 5 am and the breakfast buffet was available. If the front desk had told us this, we would have just gone downstairs for breakfast at 5:00 or 5:15 am. For this reason, we are rating this hotel "average" rather than "very good" or "excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good start to our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Margoatnumbersix
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the start of our holiday. It is a British Airways recommended hotel and what a good recommendation it is! We paid £60 for the night for the three of us (2 adults, one child) via BA. We were upgraded on check-in to a superior room - the room was really comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. Amazing shower that has water jets coming at you at every angle! Black out blind meant we overslept so beware. Really comfortable beds. Parked our car in the hotel car park which was underground and right handy! Staff were really friendly and helpful. Used the pool which was lovely, bar was nice and not too expensive. We got a taxi to the hotel as we couldn't find the shuttle bus! This was a bit expensive (about 17 euros) but at least it took us straight to the hotel. Metro is literally across the road which takes you to the centre of town fairly easily (a couple of changes but no more difficult than the London Underground and at least it is air conditioned!) All in all I can't recommend this hotel enough - we are already looking to book again for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great value, awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DoDutch
Reviews.Content: Browsing to find a good 4 star airport hotel, I came across Pullman. It's a bit more expensive than the other hotels in the neighborhood, but what a difference that makes. In the US, you would pay easily close to double the amount for this high-end hotel. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the lay-out is nice and the interior looks very chique. The rooms though are above my expectations: roomy, with a electric roll-down screen that truly darkens your room against the bright Spanish sun. The bathroom is bliss! Equipped with an all-shower heads shower and all the amenities you need. I found my room quiet, even when there was a wedding ceremony and party outside near the pool. I never heard them. I don't think there were many guests in the hotel, so I never hear my neighbor. The restaurant is kind of small, but sufficient. It has a nice feel to it. Food is good. Breakfast was above average and tasteful. The free airport shuttle takes you first to another hotel for guest pick-up and then goes to the airport. Allow at least 20 minutes from hotel to the international terminal and inquire when the bus leaves. The bus chauffeur did not help me with my luggage. The location of the hotel is kind of boring, so if you think you'll go out for a nice stroll... It's in the middle of a business district that is plain dead after business hours. This is a very good hotel for arriving, eating in the hotel, sleeping and leaving again. There is a metro stop very close by (less than 5 minute walk) which will bring you to the center for Madrid (but you will have to change metro lines a couple of times). All in all, I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: adrianal
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel for my Christmas holiday last year. The hotel is outside Madrid but only a subway ride away. It has a free shuttle but you must be patient because it does stop at several other hotels, still it’s free and free to me is always good. The hotel is modern, clean and the service is great. We even left my luggage their for 3 days while I travelled to Paris and had no problems claiming it when we got back to Madrid. The rooms are big, the bed is super comfortable and you get free wi-fi. The breakfast which was included in my reservation was OUTSTANDING. There isn’t much to do around the hotel but there is a subway station a block away. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near airport.”
Reviews.Author: Reddog2316
Reviews.Content: Located in a business park near the airport. Very modern and clean. Great location if you need to stay by the airport. Shuttle service runs often but it stops often. Burgers at the bar if you need a snack!

Reviews.Title: “Quality near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: rigboy
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel very late one night, only had 5 hours sleep as I had an early flight the next day....All i can say is that the beds were very comfortable, the hotel looked to be of a very good standard and that the the Staff at check in were friendly......

Reviews.Title: “Mini Bar Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: Jo D
Reviews.Content: The Madrid Airport Pullman is not a bad hotel, though frankly there isn't a lot of competition. But my stay was ruined recently by the fact that at check-out I was told I owed 22 euros for the mini-bar. I had used nothing from the room bar, and told the clerk. I asked the clerk to specify what I was supposed to have used, but he didn't know. He said "Oh, maybe water, things like that". Tis conversation took place at around 5:30 a.m, as I faced into a tough trip to the United States. The last thing I needed was this stress. I am sick and tired of being ripped-off by Spanish hotels with their bogus minibar charges. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, make sure you book the modernised rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Bengolini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very luxurious and had the best beds I have used at any hotel. book through booking.com 40 euros per night and pay a 15 euros upgrade when you check in to upgrade from classic room. total is 55 euros a night for a room worth 3 times that including breakfast. The location is great for commuting into Madrid which is only a 20 minute ride away. Metro station is only 100m away. The restaurant is very expensive but there is a nice cafe bar across the road and if you walk 10 mins you will find mcdonalds, lots of cafes bars and a massive supermarket. spend half a day wandering round the park Juan Carlos 1st right on the doorstep it is fascinating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice otpion”
Reviews.Author: honestopinions77
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Madrid (airport) offers great value most of the time. The "new" rooms are lovely, in a typical Pullman style, the beds are comfy and the rooms are spacious. There is a metro stop a five minute walk from the hotel, which has you in the middle of the city in 15 minutes, so this is a great spot to stay if you are only "overnighting" in Madrid. The hotel offers free shuttle from the airport, which is handy. Note that the transfers dont start until about 6:30am back to the airport, so if you have an early start (a flight before 8am for example) you will probably have to take a cab back to the airport, a five minute ride, which with airport fees etc cost me Euro17 - on the hgih side. The Pullman is also right next door to the Novotel, so you can eat at either restaurant. Not many other restaurants around as it is a bit of a business area, there is a MacDonalds and a few cafes a 15 minute walk away though.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations near the airport”
Reviews.Author: garywcook
Reviews.Content: I connect through the Madrid Barajas Airport often. This airport is a wasteland for easy access hotels. I think it was built to support the taxi business. The taxis are expensive and the drivers are always lost if you give them a hotel name. The shuttle system is inefficient and slow with most hotels if it exists at all. I prefer the metro. This hotel is just 1 stop from T1-3 or 3 stops from T4. About 10 minutes. The hotel is minutes away from the stop and easy to see when you exit. I think its is an excellent choice for an overnight near the airport or business in the area. No time to checkout the restaurants. The neighborhood surrounding the Hotel and "Feria" is new. It seems to be safe and quiet, perhaps a little too quiet for some. If you are looking for a selection of shopping, restaurants, or night life, I don't think you'll find it here.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: lwarbie
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it's a reasonable price for a weekend stay- modern, comfortable bed but the breakfast was by far the best thing about this hotel. So many choices - sweet, savoury, international and traditional- Nespresso machine with capsules... all you can ask for. Shame the bar doesn't stay open longer and the service isn't very friendly. Would recommend this hotel for the amenities and food, however if you are looking for a centrally located hotel this is not the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business-class hotel close to Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in the Pullman Madrid Airport & Feria during a layover. It is an attractive and efficient business class hotel that is similar to the W Hotels in the US: modern style with very good execution. The room was generous in size and had good quality furniture. The bed was very comfortable. The shower was an unnecessarily complex six-headed beast but was a pleasant diversion. The entire room was very clean and very quiet. I never heard any noise from the outside world. The free shuttle service was an important plus and operates every 30 minutes on schedule. I got a prepaid rate that include the morning breakfast buffet for an extra eight euros; this was well worth the modest cost. The buffet offered a good range of pastries, fruit, meat, egg dishes (yummy spanish omelette!), cereals, and juices. I also had dinner the evening before in the bar area. Mostly standard business hotel menu and prices, but higher than usual quality. There were some interesting local dishes on the menu, such as the whole grilled shrimp that I got (yummy, but what a mess!). I understand that the metro station to Madrid is nearby, but I did not have time to take advantage of that option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality Hotel, Free WiFi, Best Beds Ever”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: Wow! The beds, pillows and bedlinen are the best ever. It was a shame not to be able to spend the whole day snuggled up. Good hotel, clean, modern, convenient, efficient close to airport and exhibition halls. Free airport shuttle and 100yds from metro station. Rooms were well appointed, large moden bathroom. Just how hotels should be...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... but I feel like I was conned out of $19 euros for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Julie L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Madrid for his business trip. We came a few days early and stayed at another hotel in center city, then moved out to this hotel. When we checked in, the guy at the front desk told us that breakfast was included in our room. The next morning, when we arrived at breakfast, the hostess told us that only one breakfast was included and we'd have to pay nearly $25USD for the other breakfast. Reluctantly, we paid the money since there is very little around the hotel. The breakfast was fine, but not $25USD worth. I'm not a very big person, and I shouldn't be much of a threat to a buffet proprietor, so I felt like they should have just let me eat some of the fruit and torta and call it a day. It would have been good customer service just to let me eat breakfast without this outlandish charge. I did not feel like a valued guest so I took my money elsewhere for my remained breakfasts. You might be asking yourself, where did she go for breakfast? The answer is far, far away. Why? Because there's really nothing around the hotel. The second morning of our stay, I slept in and, famished from a long night of sleep, went looking for breakfast. I walked, and walked, and walked some more. I stopped into a couple of restaurants about a 10-15 walk away, but none of them served breakfast. As I was about to loop back around and go slumming at Micky D's, I found a cute little cafe and got my cafe con leche and croissant for less the 4 Euros. (Sticking tongue out at the hotel). The rooms are nice and the metro in convenient. It's a fine hotel to stay in for a meeting or an event at the convention center, but for a vacation stay closer to center city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for La Feria visitors”
Reviews.Author: jmgw1964
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay if you're visiting La Feria. No lugging luggage, just across the road. Very nice room, clean and spacious. Will definitely go back when I'm there for business. Just had bar food which was fine and breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suntoucher75
Reviews.Content: stayed at the pullmann to attend FItur at the Madrid Feria. Can't fault the hotel in any aspect. Great room great service, food in the restaurant was delicious especially at dinner. location is perfect for the Feria but has a metro stetion 50 meters away which brings you to downtown in 20 mins. Free shuttle to the airport a extra plus. Strongly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 747wade
Reviews.Content: Firstly this hotel is not close to the city centre...requiring a Metro trip (Metro station 100m away) with a line change and takes overall about 45 mins....but is close to the airport about 15-20 mins. The other only other downside is some of the receptionists are not overly welcoming....but note it's not all of them. The hotel is modern with sombre tones in both rooms and hallways with the lobby area a bit brighter. Some of the rooms can be a little dark depending on which side of the building you're on as it's surrounded by office. But overall they are clean comfortable modern a a fairly speedy WiFi. The bathrooms are again dark with black slate but modern with a large walk in shower. The only problem is that the controls for the shower is overly complex though once mastered you have many options on how you like your shower. The food in Mare Nostrum is excellent but the 20 or so times i've been to this hotel it's been open only about 4 times which is a pity as it's also popular with the locals which is always a good sign of good restaurant. El Patio is good but has a limited menu and can get very busy. The prices are not cheap but not outrageously expensive either. The breakfast is good with many spanish specialities but not many hot items but you can order an omelettes or fried eggs. Overall a good hotel for business and if you don't mind the travelling can be used for leisure as the Metro is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Eriugena
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive but excellent hotel. The front lobby is large and welcoming. The rooms are nicely designed, large and very comfortable, bordering on luxurious. The service, especially the room service, is second to none. We ordered lasagne at four in the morning without any problems- twice. Judging from other reviews, this obviously saved us expense at the restaurant! The hotel is located in a business area, very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable. i loved the pillows and bedsheets:) service was very good. though it is far from the city, but for us it was great as it is very close to the business venue. Downtown is just 10 -- 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stays”
Reviews.Author: yk1978
Reviews.Content: I had a high number of business trips in the city in 2011 and I used to stay in that hotel. It is a very nice hotel: the service is almost perfect, the room is usually very great and i love the bathroom and the shower... thank you for the complementary water in the room.. (con: all the TV channels and for instance the french channels don't show up!, please fix that). The breakfast is nice as well but it is every day the same, more varied food is also welcome! The staff is nice as well but would be great if the staff in the restaurant can make efforts in English... As for the location, the area is quiet and there is a nice park nearby. It is about 100m from the metro station and about 25min to get to Town.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pullman Madrid Airport & Feria”
Reviews.Author: zarratravel
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using booking.com at Euro140 per night with breakfast. The staffs were great, speaks good english and always ready to assist in anything. The rooms is big with comfy bed and pillows. Complimentary mineral waters (most of the hotel in Spain that we had stayed charged us) with fast internet were provided to guests as well. Ohh..and good breakfast even for Muslim like us. Also, good to know that the train station is a nice walking distance from the hotel as well. The hotel definitely one of the best hotel we have stayed during our 12 days Spain holiday. I will have no problem to return again to this hotel for my future Madrid trip.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a great location convenient for appointments within Madrid and in the surrounding area. Informal bar area very good for business meetings with great bar service. I will be using this hotel again when I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Pullman Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have business in this part of Madrid fairly often and have often stayed in the Pullman... it never dissappoints due to the excellent service and attention of the staff in the hotel. From the check in to the check out everyone is very solicitous and helpful and I always get a friendly and geniune "hello"; as I have stayed here more than once there are those employees that actually remember me and what I like to order or have. The restaurants are of excellent quality and it is a pity that the main Mare Nostrum is now only open for lunch. Room service is very quick and happy to accomodate for my diet preferences.

Reviews.Title: “Good for travelers”
Reviews.Author: SemaTyk
Reviews.Content: Close to metro and to airport, clean air. Some parking around. Good for travelers

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Pullman Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful two nights at the Pullman - - a hotel I have come to prefer over the years and I would certainly stay here again. The rooms are bright and new - - the ammenities are perfect. The location, near the airport makes it my preference for the night before departure from Madrid and the Metro stop just across the street makes it easy to get downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: beef365
Reviews.Content: The Pullman is in a good location for Feria De Madrid, and a few minutes walk from the metro or the venue. However the incidentals at this hotel are nothing short of a crime. Breakfast is €19 for an average continental selection. Drinks in the bar are incredibly expensive at €11 for a single spirit without mixer. If dining and drinking in this hotel you will easily incur another €100 a night, when you could stay in a better hotel in the city where you can have breakfast and meals outside the hotel, and pay less to travel to and from Feria de Madrid at €1,50 on the Metro. The rooms are large enough but tired and worn with light fixings hanging loose or switches broken. We stayed here for 6 nights on business and will not be using this or associated hotels again. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel at Feria Madrid”
Reviews.Author: partagas92
Reviews.Content: Former Sofitel rebranded as Pullman, this hotel will deliver whatever businessmen are looking for: In front of IFEMA Feria Madrid, close by the airport. Services is great. Nice and conveninet meeting rooms available, very classy. Special congrats to the head of F&B Frederic, who always has time to welcome regular customers. Free wifi, efficient rooms, nice breakfast area, attentive personal. Definitively a recommandation if you have business conducted in the perimeter.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: There are several very good reasons to stay at this hotel. Here’s why we selected it for a two-night stay prior to flying home from Madrid: • It is very easy to drive to the hotel as you approach the city. It’s right off of an expressway, and you don’t have to negotiate city-center traffic or streets. • There is a pool for children to play and adults to cool down. • The Metro station is a half block from the hotel entrance for easy access to the city. • The hotel offers a complementary airport shuttle, and it is just minutes from the airport. The ease of loading luggage and the savings over taxi fare is significant. Other travelers understandably could prefer to stay in a more central location. It’s worth noting that there is virtually no street life (cafés, bars, restaurants, shops) in the immediate area. The streets and sidewalks were deserted for the weekend (so of course, it was very quiet—another advantage to the location). It took us about thirty minutes to reach Puerta del Sol on the Metro. We pulled up to the hotel and were almost immediately greeted by a doorman who helped unload luggage from the car. He helpfully suggested storing a few items that we would not need, which reduced the clutter in our room. The receptionist was polite and efficient. Our room looked slightly more worn than the stylish lobby. Furnishings and fixtures had a used appearance, but everything was absolutely clean and functional. The bed was firm and the sheets felt wonderful. The hotel also supplied a comfortable extra bed for one of our children. The room was a bit cramped for two adults and two children, but otherwise we enjoyed the stay. We got good rest after a long drive, so we felt very refreshed for our long flight home.

Reviews.Title: “good location for business”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Tyhe Pullman hotel is well located for meetings at the conference cente (which is rigth accross the street). If you want to go downtown the is a metro stop only a block away. Be sure to check multiple sights when booking as I notice different rates for the same period when booking through the conference organizers vs. Accorhotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and our 4 teenagers. Nothing negative to report. Everything went perfectly well. Employees were nice and unlike at other locations in Spain enough of them were talking English or French. Since we arrived in the evening, we would have enjoyed using the pool a bit later than 9pm but that's a detail. We had the possibility to benefit of a summer discount. For the price it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab service but get a refurbed room!”
Reviews.Author: AngelFishLush
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on a business trip. Free shuttle from the airport, impressive reception & bar area and a nice welcome when I arrived. Great start but then I got to the room, they don't all look like the website. I have attached photos but it needed a refurb! Paint peeling off the wall, cracked skirts, black mould around the bath etc. That said the bed was huge and comfy and the shower was powerful. It was ok for one night, could be amazing if they updated all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only issue I had was with the very awful hair dryer in the bathroom. I brought my own European dryer, but there was no other outlet in the bathroom, so I had to blow dry my hair at desk without a mirror. Also the room seemed to be a bit humid, which is strange for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Kwanyen
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful clean hotel. The rooms have everything you need to be comfortable. They have a nice bar area and nice restaurant. This is a business type hotel, but still very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Handy location but only average quality.”
Reviews.Author: Achilles_F12
Reviews.Content: The hotel shuttle bus runs half hourly from Madrid airport and does a circuit of all the terminals. If you're in a hurry to get checked in then it maybe wise to take a taxi. This property clearly used to be a Sofitel and one gets the sense that faced with a choice of refurbishing or downgrading the latter was chosen. Rooms are comfortable but feel tired bathrooms have plenty of chipped and cracked tiles. Staff are efficient. I made the mistake of asking for laundry to be done on a Sunday (the laundry form stated a 'daily service' but it's Monday to Friday) but housekeeping undertook a wash for me instead of sending out to their contractor - this was appreciated. The restaurants are nothing to write home about, in fact only one was open. Breakfast was a decent offering. The hotel overcharged me. I booked and paid in advance on the Accor website 153.00 EUR. My subsequent Amex bill shows that in fact the hotel took a pre-payment of 229.50 EUR and then a further room charge effectively doubling the charge. So far I've only managed a partial refund. It's hassle you don't need and ensures you'll never come to their hotel again. Overall - it's Okay but you might find the Novotel next door to be better value.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stays.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We like to stay overnight in an airport hotel before and after a long flight. However, there is no airport hotel like The Sofitel at Heathrow's Terminal 5 which we always use in London, so The Pullman is the best for location to Madrid Airport. The main purpose of the Pullman Hotel is to accommodate business travellers attending the numerous Ferias so for this, the hotel is ideally situated. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful and attentive, so we like to stay there whenever we are travelling in and out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in easy reach from airport and fair grounds”
Reviews.Author: HotelRoomBuyer
Reviews.Content: From the airport you get to this modern hotel by underground or with the shuttle bus. Both options are pretty easy and safe. The hotel has nicely refurbished rooms (used to be a Sofitel before) with all modern comfort in nice strong colours (black, red, grey ...). The bathroom is beautiful, very stylish. Breakfast is served in a relatively small restaurant (as far as I can remember no daylight in the whole room). The bar area is located in the middle of the reception area which reminds a bit of a Courtyard and is not adequate for the class of hotel in my opinion. Overall a very good choice if you have to do business in this area or the fair grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable business hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: large rooms, exceptional bed quality, free internet. Location is good if you are on a business trip and are not interested in going out in Madrid, otherwise, it is very far from the centre. Food at the restaurant is good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable hotel in heart of business area. Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Usenko
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel for 1 night, starting from 15-May-2010 before my flight on the next day. This hotel features a free shuttle service to and from airport, but I didn't use it since we arrived by car. As usual I booked the hotel beforehand. It was my mistake but I made reservation for 15-April-2010, not for 15-May-2010. I just mixed up the month (April instead of May). The front office manager said me: Don't worry we will try to manage it. And he gave me a room and the same price as it was in my original reservation. All these formalities took no more than 5 minutes. The receptionist spoke perfect English, that is unusual for Spain. He was very helpful and friendly. The room was great. Nothing to complain about. The sleeping quality was fantastic. Lots of comfortable pillows. That was very helpful since the next day we had a long connecting flight. Free Wi-Fi in the room. The hotel is located at new business area, apart from the historic centre of Madrid. But you may reach Sol just in 30 minutes by metro, that is close to the hotel and very efficient. The price for the ride is just 1 EUR. Didn't go to the breakfast since we preferred to sleep before the flight and take some meal at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when doing a conference close by. Nice hotel. Very clean. Rooms new and upscale. Food good. Restaurant great for included breakfast. Location not to great for pleasure. Extremely close to subway though, which was very efficient. Not a lot of stuff to do close to hotel except work.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Supermercado
Reviews.Content: We were there for a couple of nights earlier this year. (January). It is a standard 4 star hotel with no fantasy and no surprises. We requested a quiet room and were given the room located by the air con equipment above the kitchen area : this probably was the noisiest room of them all. We aked for a change but they weren't very cooperative. Staff at frontdesk was bad and non professional. Rooms were comfortable but on the small side. For some reason, the common areas were smelling plastic. Not very pleasant. Location not too bad but not really for first time visitors as it took over 40 minutes to reach the main places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: tinuxonabs
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the advantage of being close to the Barajas Airport and the Feria de Madrid so it was very convenient since i was in Madrid for SIMMS Fashion Show. My room had a good night view and the members of staff are very consistent. I'll gladly stay there again anytime am in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - meals a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 1allsop
Reviews.Content: We had to spend one night in Madrid to get on a flight the next day and we really liked it. It is close to the airport, the rooms are spacious, modern and clean. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and there is a free shuttle to and from the airport every 30 minutes. If there is one thing that we found a bit disturbing, it is the overpriced meals at the Hotel's restaurant: a small dinner and a breakfast for two cost us more than the hotel room itself. In an nutshell: Excellent hotel - but eat outside, if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TiredWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very Quiet rooms. We could not hear any other guests. The beds were comfortable & the blinds made the room extra dark. I added a second room at check-in and found that the front desk was charging me $40E less than my on-line travel website reservation. In-room internet is available for a crazy charge of $19E per 24 hrs. Not very business friendly! Most hotels that I travel to offer internet connections for FREE! Last year this property was a Sofitel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: GeoDevon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel the night before catching an ongoing flight. Like a previous reviewer said, the rooms are more or less what you would expect, but we found it hard to sleep because the room was so hot and the air conditioning was not very useful !! The reception staff were not helpful upon arrival and the restaurant was closed. We arrives at 9.30 and it should have been open until 11.30. I have stayed in several Sofitels near airports and this is the most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but only just”
Reviews.Author: TedMeades
Reviews.Content: This is an undistinguished four-star hotel offering reasonably comfortable accommodation but not much else. Although the rooms have all the attributes you would expect for this standard of hotel (comfortable bed, armchair, desk, flat-screen TV, shower screen and decent toiletries) they are also disappointingly small, and a couple booking into a “superior” twin/double for a week or more will struggle to find sufficient wardrobe and storage space. The breakfast room, lobby bar and restaurant are also smaller than you might expect and can feel cramped during busy periods. Breakfast is a cold buffet, consisting of a dreary selection of chopped fruit, breads, cold meats, cheeses and pastries, none of which is particularly good. There is supposedly a hot option but no one seems to order it and the staff certainly do not encourage guests to do so. Breakfast costs all of 25 Euros and is a complete rip off at that price. The bar offers a very small selection of tapas. These are OK, but be prepared to wait because the service here is very slow, even by Madrid standards. The service in the restaurant is slightly better but the food is nothing special. One of the worst things about this hotel is its location. Convenient for the airport, yes, being just a short cab ride away; but it is also slap bang in the middle of the most boring part of Madrid. If you want to see the real city then you’ve a choice between taking a taxi (expensive) and travelling on the Metro. The Metro station is just round the corner from the hotel, but you still have a 30-minute to one-hour journey to most of the places of interest. I have read some disparaging remarks about the service at this hotel. On the whole I found it to be okay but no better than it needs to be. One slip up occurred on our penultimate day when the maids forgot to make up the room. We were hoping that the management would offer us a late checkout for the following day (to 14:00) in compensation, but nothing was doing. Normally I would give this type of hotel three stars, but the ungracious attitude re the late checkout and the rip-off price of the breakfast has cost it a star in my evaluation. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel for anything other than a one-night stopover from the airport or as a crash pad for those people who have business in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel with few surprises”
Reviews.Author: GottaLottaMiles
Reviews.Content: This Sofitel is a decent spot for airport proximity, but offers little else. The rooms are small, quiet and comfortable, with good beds and up-to-date fixtures. Not much to offer on the TV in English, but this is true everywhere in Spain. The hotel restaurant is not a great dinner option, and there are only a couple of places within walking distance. You can find something for one or two meals; it's not a good location if you are planning a longer stay (unless you are going into Madrid by train every day). There is a business center but the PCs they have are old; they don't even support Java-enabled websites so reading web mail is difficult. Probably OK if you bring your own PC. There is a free shuttle to the airport, and it's only about 15 minutes away. Bottom line - a good spot for an overnight before an early flight, or after a late arrival. Otherwise stay in downtown Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice of Airport Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: feliz79
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give an up to date review as i have seen nothing on here for 2008. I have stayed in a Sofitel Hotel before and it doesn't disappoint. The beds are by far the best! So comfy i didn't want to leave! The TV has a decent choice of channels. Room service is great. Hotel service was good noone was rude to me. I booked through expedia.co.uk and got a queen room for £67! Bargain for one night. The Hotel provides a small blue van with Sofitel and Novotel on the side of it. You wait it's every 30mins actually not every 5 mins. One person will always be picking someone up, so a 10-15 drive to hotel there and back. Not many people speak english in Madrid so learn spanish! Perfect location for the Metro. I will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: senobar_s
Reviews.Content: On the way to Marrakech we had a one night stop in Madrid and stayed at this hotel because of their good rate of $150/ night! Positives: 1. The subway stop (pink line) is a one minute walk. 2. There is a free airport shuttle. 3. The breakfast is kick ass but 26 Euros per person Negatives: 1. Even the non smoking floors have a faint cigarette smell. 2. The staff is kind of stiff & standoffish. 3. Breakfast serves don’t speak English. Overall, I’d recommend this hotel if you have an early morning flight to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Positive and negative things”
Reviews.Author: frikis
Reviews.Content: We were stayed in Madrid Campo de las Naciones Hotel for a week. In general the hotel is o.k, it has some positive and negative things. Positive: The bed is very confortable, there is a pillow menu! and the tv is great. The breakfast has many things to choose. The pool area and the kindness of the lifeguard that was very kind and looked for my children very well. The staff is o.k. , good cocktels in bahia bar. Negative: The cleaning service was poor and a light bulb of my room was broken for abut four days. The music in the pool was a little bored (chill-out and rare music all the time) and they said me that don't serve drinks because the pool bar is closed. The restaurants are very expensive I recommend this hotel to everyone who enjoy a morning under the sun in the swimming pool, was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fab bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: kanella
Reviews.Content: Try and stay on the 4th floor - one of the executive floors. Luxurious comfortable beds, with a pillow menu, great shower, shame there was no bath however. Good location to the Fiere de Madrid and metro. All in all a very good Sofitel experience.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful facility, service is lacking!”
Reviews.Author: chicagosuburbanite
Reviews.Content: Just left there yesterday--6/20/07. As stated by ther reviews, it is a very nice hotel, the beds are awesome. If you have stayed in a Sofitel in a country that has customer service standards though, this one will sirely disappont. Checking in we were the only ones there, 3 men behind the counter and we were treated as though we were interrupting something better. Ended up having 3 rooms and they could not have been less hospitable. The worst was dinner. We went to the garden restaurant whihc is beautiful as well. We were seated and ordered. 5 of us in the party, 3 meals came out together. 15 minutes later (and this is NO exaggeration) dinner #4 came with no explanation or apology. But then dinner #5 did not come for 15 more minutes--again, no apology, no explalantion. Everyone at the table was finished eating when I received my meal. We were trying to catch a show so we asked for our bill immediately. The waiter left, returned with it and turned on his heels, Again--as though we were an interruption to his day. When we came in there were only 2 other diners. When we left 6 couples had come in after us and I was the last one served. No one offered even the slightest hint that this was unsatisfactory. While I was finishing one of our party went out to get 2 cabs since we now did not have time to use the Metro. The bell man hailed one from about 15 feet away. When the rest of the party did not come out immediately, the bell man began aggresively suggesting to our party that we better get out there or someone was going to have to pay this cab! What a great thought--here we are paying for 3 rooms, we have 1 cab waiting when we asked for 2 because 5 can not get in Spanish cabs, and the bell man was getting huffy with us. I was fed up with rude Spanish male employees by this time. We had been in Spain for 10 days so we understood the culture, this was quite disappointing due to the attitude of the male staff. While we are ACCOR travel club members, I will remember never to stay at this location again. I even filled out a complaint, which I can say in years I have simply not done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aglazer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights, one directly after arriving on an international flight and one directly before departing. Hotel was incredibly comfortable; staff was very nice and accommodating. Nice bar downstairs. There's a Corte Ingles and several restaurants within a 10 minute walk. Comfy beds. Highly recommended for an airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: BritishVirgin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property four or five times, and generally recommend it. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable and well appointed. Staff is courteous. The location is convenient, though the trip to the new Iberia terminal is a bit of a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Always the Airport Best”
Reviews.Author: Catherine K
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Madrid visitor, I usually try to stay at different hotels each time. The Sofitel near the airport, in my opinion, is absolutely the best!! I've stayed at several other MAD airport hotels....this has big comfy soft beds, great bath, quiet & safe, staff always helpful-as BA loses my luggage every time out of the last 9++-so Sofitel generously and happily supplies every necessity they have available. Always clean, professional-wonderful. Very close to the airport, but enough distance to have significantly higher standards than a typical 'box' airport hotel. Booking thru their website gives the best price, and it's an easy cancellation policy if things change.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable near airport”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: I booked prepaid rate via Sofitel website for one night, flying in from Alicante and then out from Madrid. I chose for shuttle, a/c, nonsmoking near airport. My arrival flight was delayed so I arrived past 1am, too late for shuttle, so I took a taxi from Terminal 4. I think he took the long way round even though I know that terminal is a mile at least from the others. The hotel shuttle to Terminal 1 the next morning was much shorter ride and promptly on time as promised. Desk staff was pleasant and helpful. Room held comfortable bed with heavy comforter and fluffy pillows, desk, chairs, tv, closet. My room overlooked the street and exposition halls. Street noise if opened window, so I turned on a/c to high fan. Should have also pushed down lever to lower temp I think as I awoke very hot with that comforter as only blanket. Double doors between room and hallway ensured quiet. Large bath with shower that doesn't flood the room. Agree with earlier poster that high step out of tub is dangerous. There is a small grab bar--use it! very easy to slip. Also agree about wimpy hairdryer. It eventually gets the job done. Didn't spring for the pricey breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limabre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Deserves it stars and the price for the room, which was well kept and air conditioned. Very near to the trade fair area and the airport. Friendly staff. Only two minors: the doors between the elevator and the rooms were quite heavy, and almost impossible to open for one with a minor physical disability. And breakfast was very disappointing, with a few very sweet breads, some fruit, and not to fresh looking cereal, @ 25 euro!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Sus63
Reviews.Content: Great location for your last night in Spain if you want to be 5 minutes from the airport. They do have a free shuttle into Madrid, but the availability is limited and it is only one way. They have a very convenient free shuttle from the hotel to the airport. Only took 5 minutes. Very low stress way to spend your last night before flying home. The hotel room was fantastic. High end bed and bedding. Large marble bathroom. Walking distance to a small mall with a Corte Ingles, grocery store and some restaurants. Also close to a park. They do have a business center with internet access - kind of pricey and the printers had no ink. I tried to print my boarding passes and couldnt. Instead of just loading the ink, they refunded by 4 Euro fee for 15 minutes of internet usage. You can get internet access from your room for 10 Euro for the day as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Madrid Sofitel post-cruise Nov 12, 2005. They offer free shuttle pick up and drop-off to the Madrid-Barajas Airport. You must call from the airport for them to send the shuttle. Check in was quick and the luggage arrived immediatley to our rooms. Excellent service from the staff. We had only one day in Madrid and the front staff arranged a taxi for us (party of 6). However, he later discovered there was a manisfestation going on and and told the taxi driver to leave and suggested we take the metro (train) for safety reasons. The hotel and rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. Only a couple of minor things I may mention: the hair dryers provided are of very poor quality - looks more like a vacuum so bring you own. The tub sits too high above the floor which makes it a little dangerous when getting in and especially out of the tub. I fell and injured my knee and shoulder. No drinking water is provided in the rooms. The phones were difficult to operate - we couldn't call others in our party. We requested a wake up call expecting to have the phone ring at the requested time, instead their wake up service is a gentlemen that knocks on your and everyone else's door at the designated times. Maybe the phones weren't working? The Cafe con Leche in the lobby cafe is excellent and reasonably priced - don't forget to try that! Other than that, our stay was very pleasant and would definitately return to this hotel. One more thing, you will probably get a better rate going onto the Sofitel website than using booking engines.

Reviews.Title: “What airport?”
Reviews.Author: lbalad
Reviews.Content: If you want a high class hotel away from the noise of downtown,look no further!.Whilst only 5 mins from airport by free shuttle bus,I never saw or heard a single plane.It is situated in a new business district,which last weekend was quiet,maybe busier during week.Metro is 5 mins walk away,highly effecient,downtown in 20 mins or so.As mentioned before,hotel forms part of a complex with Novotel.Each has its own outdoor pool and bar,and you are free to use either.The hotel is not high tech,but is well presented.The bedrooms feature comfy beds and linens,minibar,free safe,bathrobes and slippers,designer smellies,turn down service with sweets and weather forecast.Breakfast is buffet style,with your choice of hot selection waitress served.Obviously bar and restaurant prices are not the cheapest,but when you stay somewhere as classy as this,to be expected.Very impressed overall!.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, well staffed hotel. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Lugh_Lamfhada
Reviews.Content: After a busy 16 days of exploring Spain, my wife and I stayed here the last night of our trip before a long journey home. We took the train in from Valencia and the trip was awful, so we were frazzled by the time we got to the hotel. This promptly melted away as we were greeted with an elegant business hotel surrounded by mahogany and old paintings. The floors were marble. The woman at reception spoke very good English and it was evident from the way she spoke that she learned English in Ireland. We were given a room with two single beds by mistake but it was corrected with a smile and with no problems whatsoever. The beds are covered in soft, pillowy Italian linens and are incredibly comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and comes with personal grooming kits and brand name soaps and beauty supplies (for the ladies). There was also a complimentary bottle of spring water on ice when we got there. Although we didn't use the pool, it looked clean and well maintained. The breakfast buffet was included in the price of our room and was quite good with lots of choices. The restaurant had a nice nautical feel to it (dark wood, emerald carpet, deep red leather chairs) which was obviously fitting as it is a seafood restaurant. Overall, this was a comfortable, first class experience. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll definitely stay here before the flight home. A mere 10 minutes from the airport and shuttles running every 30 minutes is astoundingly convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds! Lousy Food.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before my husband and I had to catch a flight out of Barajas airport. The hotel was in a very convenient location and had a parking garage (which was an extra charge). The room was extremely comfortable. I wish I could have packed the bed up and taken it back home with me! My one issue was with the room service--there was very little selection and what we did order was tasteless and extremely overpriced. Other than the hotel's own restaurants, there weren't any other eateries in the area, so this certainly isn't the place to get a good meal. Despite that, I was quite pleased with the room and got a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Sayer
Reviews.Content: Suprisingly good. The hotel whilst close to the airport is not at all noisy and doesn't have the feel of an airport hotel. The bedrooms are a decent size, clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly, speak good English and are helpful. Location isn't ideal for tourists, but if you are going to the Congress Centre you couldn't be much closer.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very convenient & comfortable - the best I've found yet in the airport area. No problems or concerns - thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed It Very Much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Spain here after a 10 day trip. We enjoyed this hotel very much. Our room was clean and fresh with a very nice bathroom. The beds made with crisp white linens, duvets and feather bed mattress toppers were extremely comfortable. The food service in the bar area and terrace restaurant was very good. The free shuttle service to the airport was very efficient and easy. We got a great rate through the hotel website by paying the full amount in advance. I think it was 77 euros. The breakfast was expensive but good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for businessmen, but also if you wish to be a turist (underground station is very close and takes you to City Center in 20 minutes). Service is good and stuff is very friendly. Only had troubles with the electronic key a couple of times. Breakfast is on an average, but expensive (22 EUR).

HotelInfo.Name: Pullman Madrid Airport & Feria
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Capital de Espana 10 | Campo de las Naciones, 28042 Madrid, Spain
